entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition seamless integration with Shopify - Complete Setup and Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP and Shopify? We‚Äôve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Shopify can often be a challenging and time-consuming task ‚Äî especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and Shopify
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we‚Äôll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we‚Äôll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package ‚Äî so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package accelerator isn‚Äôt just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs.

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we‚Äôve developed a dedicated Shopify integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your Shopify storefront and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

The  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  üõí  Product information
  •  üì¶  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • üí≤Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  üë§  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers ‚Äî a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The Shopify Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Shopify, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

üì¶ From SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify:

  • ‚úÖ Replicate Products ‚Äì Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your Shopify storefront.
  • üìä Replicate Product Stock ‚Äì Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • üí≤ Replicate Product Prices & Discounts ‚Äì Automatically update pricing and promotional details in Shopify.
  • üöö Replicate Delivery Details ‚Äì Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via Shopify.

üõíFrom Shopify to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  • üë• Replicate B2C Customers ‚Äì Capture and transfer customer data from Shopify to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • üßæReplicate Orders ‚Äì Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ‚ùå Replicate Order Cancellations ‚Äì Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • üîÅ Replicate Order Returns ‚Äì Automatically push return details from Shopify into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

üöÄ How to Set Up the ‚ÄúShopify Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition‚Äù Package

Integrating Shopify with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is now easier than ever ‚Äî thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

‚úÖPrerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • üîë  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP ‚Äì Business Technology Platform).
  • üßæ Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • üõç  A Shopify Partner or Merchant Account.
  • üìò  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and Shopify. 
  • üåê  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • üìòDetailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub

 üõ†Ô∏è  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

üì¶ Step 2: Import the Shopify Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for ‚ÄúShopify Adapter for SAP Integration Suite‚Äù.
  • Click ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure Shopify Adapter Installation - Installing the Shopify Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the ‚ÄúShopify Adapter Guide‚Äù and to the ‚ÄúShopify Adapter and Plug-in Installation Guide‚Äù and also refer to more details refer to section "Shopify Adapter Installation" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

üîÑStep 3: Configure Shopify iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported Shopify Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition before you can start implementing the configuration for Shopify API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      Shopify Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • Shopify Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myshopify.com/
  • Shopify Secure Parameter: The name of the Shopify access token secure parameter 

       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition secure parameter 

üß© Example Integration Flows:

  • Shopify ‚ûú SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ‚ûú Shopify: Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

üöÄStep 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in Shopify.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

üîß Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 üí° Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • üí° Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP Shopify adapte
  • üìú  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between Shopify and SAP with custom business case.
  • üß∞ Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • üß† Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • üí°  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

High Level Demo Flow to showcase Order processing along with Master data replication.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION  (to be replicated to shopify)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in Shopify and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into shopify as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in shopify
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from shopify to SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION
  • Step 10: Log into SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION as internal_sales_rep and look for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION as shipping_specialist and open app ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION public to Shopify .
  • Step 16: Open sales order in Shopify and show the OD created in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

Shopify Demo systems include the following systems - Integration Suite Tenant [along with BTP Sub-Account), SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Shopify Admin Portal, Shopify Customer Portal

Step 1:  Access the  Integration Suite tenant and view ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù integration package

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù -> ‚ÄúIntegration‚Äù
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù  , view the integration flows and details.          

Step 2: Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System to show the replicating product master

  • Access system using URL SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system as Product Master Specialist
  • Login with user = prodmaster_specialist
  • Launch the App : ‚ÄúManage Product Master Data‚Äù  and search for Product ID  (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12)
  • Note: in the demo product replication integration flow we are replicating only one product with product ID (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12) and user could decide to replicate all products / sub-set of products, based on specific functional requirements.

Step 3: Start replication of product in Integration Suite

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Discover -> Integration (only first time)
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù  , open the integration package -> copy the package
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù  ,
  • Navigate to ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and search for integration package ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify‚Äù
    • To deploy => click on the ‚Äú3 dots‚Äù of integration package and select ‚Äúdeploy‚Äù
    • Deploy would start the product replication from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify      

Step 4: Show replicated product in Shopify and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product

  • Login using URL : Shopify 
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù
  • Check and prepare the product for selling to customer
    • Check the product is replicated
    • Add the picture to publish (click on ‚ÄúMedia‚Äù and click on ‚Äú+‚Äù and select the relevant picture‚Äù
  • Add the sales channel as online store ( click on ‚ÄúManage‚Äù in ‚ÄúPublishing‚Äù section, in the popup select ‚Äúonline store‚Äù  and click on ‚Äúinclude‚Äù and click on ‚Äúdone‚Äù )
  • Set the status of the product to be ‚ÄúActive‚Äù and ‚ÄúSave‚Äù the product
  • Note: for the product to be visible for customer in shopify portal for purchasing , the status must be set to ‚ÄúActive‚Äù and sales channel to be set to ‚Äúonline store‚Äù.      

Step 5: login to shopify as customer and browse through existing products

Step 6: select the product replicated from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and add to basket

  • Purchase the product (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12)
  • Select the product from catalog
  • Click on ‚ÄúAdd to Cart‚Äù and click on ‚ÄúCheckout‚Äù
  • Account and ShipTo address would be filled automatically with the logged in user details

Step 7: enter the relevant details like payment and create order

  • Enter the Credit Card Details : Card Number, Expiration Date, Security Code
  • Click on ‚ÄúPay Now‚Äù  , order would be placed         

Step 8: check the order created in shopify

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù
  • Check the order created with fulfillment status ‚ÄúUnfulfilled‚Äù , note down the ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Order ID‚Äù  , order ID would be used to search order created in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system      

Step 9: replicate the order from shopify to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify‚Äù
  • Replication of orders in status Unfulfilled would be moved to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition .
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù      

Step 10: Log into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system as Sales Representative

  • open for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app
  • open the sales order and change the ‚ÄúRequested Delivery Date‚Äù to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Note: delivery date to be changed to today‚Äôs date, since user want to complete the delivery of the order today by creating outbound delivery today.       
     

Step 11: Log into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as Delivery shipping specialist and complete the delivery of Order

  • open for ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù app

Step 12: Enter the key details like Shipping Point and Sales Order ...

  • enter shipping point sample as 3810 (select shipping point relevant for your use-case) and enter the sales order ID create earlier and Selection Date would be defaulted to todays date
  • click on ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù
  • note down the outbound delivery ID

Step 13: Delivery shipping specialist will pic the outbound delivery

  • open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù id and enter ‚ÄúActual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter ‚Äúpicking quantity‚Äù as 1 and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù         

Step 14 : Delivery shipping specialist will Post Goods Issue for the corresponding outbound delivery

  • click on ‚ÄúPost GI‚Äù and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to ‚ÄúCompletely Processed‚Äù.      

Note : show the Sales Order ‚ÄúProcess flow‚Äù of created order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition for the corresponding order, the process flow gives visual representation of business entities created in the system (Order, Outbound Delivery, Invoice ‚Ä¶)

Step 15 : replicate the Outbound delivery from S4 public to Shopify .

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Delivery Details from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify‚Äù
  • Replication of outbound delivery from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system would be moved to Shopify and corresponding Order status would updated to ‚Äúfulfilled‚Äù in Shopify
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù         

Step 16: open sales order in shopify and check the  status of Order, it should be changed from ‚ÄúUnfullfilled‚Äù to ‚Äúfulfilled‚Äù

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù
  • With the successfully delivery , the order should be fulfilled and order status should be ‚ÄúFulfilled‚Äù , note the fields ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Order ID‚Äù  and ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Outbound Deliveries‚Äù  in order would be copied from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system          

The above steps completes the High Level Demo Flow which showcase the order processing along with product master data replication.

Note: The  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package covers Order Returns and Order Cancellation business scenarios along with Order Processing, please feel free to explore the other business process like Order Returns and Order Cancellation .

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Enabling Scalable Growth for Mid-Sized Companies
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Enabling Scalable Growth for Mid-Sized Companies


In highly competitive market, these days the impact of mid-sized companies is hard to miss; they‚Äôve learned to position themselves in a crowded market. To succeed, they stay quick, dream up fresh ideas, chase growth and yet still juggle limited money, shifting customer demands and rules from many regulation authorities. That is where SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud steps in - a strong, public-cloud answer that scales on command, speeds up innovation, offers enterprise-grade tools and cuts out most of the usual IT headaches.

Scaling Smart: Navigating Growth Challenges in the Mid-Market Sector

Mid-sized companies find themselves compressed between the big companies and the start-ups. Like the big players, they do not enjoy huge IT teams or expensive resources for year-long tech rollouts, yet their day-to-day headaches are just as trapped. Running operations in multiple countries, adjusting several product lines, keeping up with shifting rules, and pushing ahead with digital change all demand solid tools and budget. After all these conflicts, keeping companies balance sheet in shiny condition is not that easy. If they hang on to that aging ERP or a patchwork of outdated apps and systems, the drag can swallow momentum, showing up as:

  • Extra stress in meeting tough compliance standards
  • Focus shift from priorities to non-priorities activities, hurdles that block entry into fresh markets or regions
  • Isolation that keep departments talking past each other
  • On-premises systems that pile up hidden total cost of ownership
  • Rigid procedures with little automation and avoiding changes which will keep away from latest and cost-effective solution.

 What is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud product is all about?

With pre-configured best practices, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a scalable, cloud-based ERP solution that optimises business operations. Through the Central Business Configuration tool, it facilitates industry-specific configurations, minimal customisation, and quick deployment.

Continuous innovation, real-time insights, and sustainability tracking are made possible by its integrated AI, machine learning, and tools such as Signavio and SAP Analytics Cloud. Flexibility and compatibility are guaranteed by a smooth integration with both SAP and non-SAP systems.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a future-ready ERP platform that offers agility, innovation, and sustainability, making it the perfect choice for organisations looking to modernise. Below are the key features of SAP Public cloud,

Now, let‚Äôs see how all mentioned features can drive scalable growth for small and mid-sized companies.

 

1. Total cost of owner ship & Cost Effectiveness

Consider infrastructure upgrades, continuous system maintenance, specialised IT support, and those annoying manual updates. Traditional ERP systems can have some unforeseen costs. SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, on the other hand, adopts a different strategy with its subscription-based model, allowing you to benefit from predictable operational expenses and a significantly reduced total cost of ownership (TCO).

Here are a few benefits:

  • You avoid the headache of project-based upgrades and receive constant innovations and updates.
  • No requirement for sizable IT staffs or substantial physical infrastructure
  • Backups, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity are all integrated into SAP's secure data centres.

Mid-sized businesses can now more easily access and afford enterprise-grade ERP capabilities thanks to this model. By using SAP public cloud, companies can save around 50% of implementation cost.

 

2. Accelerated ROI through faster deployment and adoption

Businesses can quickly and efficiently implement SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud thanks to the SAP Activate methodology and SAP ALM. Implementation time is greatly reduced, frequently going live in 12 to 16 weeks (For less complex business), thanks to predefined business processes, guided configuration tools, and automated testing.

This type of flexibility enables mid-sized businesses to:

  • Avoid long project cycles
  • Reduce the cost of implementation
  • Reallocate internal resources to strategic business objectives.
  • See a return on investment almost immediately. Additionally, SAP provides pre-configured industry content (such as for professional services, manufacturing, and wholesale distribution), which enables businesses to more quickly align with the demands of their particular sector.

I have seen often small and mid-size industries facing lot of challenges with resources and budget, SAP Public cloud solution can be real game changer for these companies. By using SAP public cloud companies can save around 60% of their time.

3. Public cloud package ‚Äì

As per my experience, it will be always beneficial to business if they consider SAP cloud ERP as a package. It often includes ALM (Application lifecycle management), BTP (Business technology platform) and other services.

Advantages of the packages,

  • Pay as you go model
  • Cost effective
  • Bundled value
  • Quick time to value
  • Innovation Ready
  • For few products no separate licencing is required

4. Continuous Innovation, Delivered Quarterly

Thanks to automatic quarterly updates, SAP keeps your experience fresh and evolving bringing you new features, smarter tools, and meaningful enhancements like:

  • Keeping pace with changes in national laws and regulations
  • Refining processes and boosting overall performance
  • Enhancing intelligence and user experience through AI and machine learning

In todays competitive market business should focus on their priorities, it will be very dangerous for business to involved in unproductive or less productive area, especially it can be big hurdle for mid-size companies.

With Public cloud business can be competitive and flexible with enjoying access to newest product features available to them without any extra efforts on expansive upgrades and dip pre-launch testing. SAP will take care of all upgrade process on the behalf of companies so there will be very less chance of errors and failures.

5. Flexible, Future-Proof Scalability

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is thoughtfully built to grow with your business ‚Äî scaling effortlessly in every direction.

  • Companies can improve their systems by adding new functionalities as their needs evolve over a period of time, such as Integrated Order-to-Cash and Procure-to-Pay, Advanced Financial Planning & Analysis or subscription billing and real time data.
  • On other side once business expectation fulfilled they can use the same global template to expand into new business units, regions, or subsidiaries.

Since it‚Äôs built for the cloud from the ground up, businesses can easily scale without pouring money into new hardware. That makes it perfect for companies planning to grow internationally or handle mergers and acquisitions. Even mid-sized firms can tap into the public cloud to reach their goals faster and more affordably.

6. Built-in intelligent technology solutions

SAP S/4HANA Intelligent technologies that improve decision-making, simplify daily tasks, and optimise business processes abound in the public cloud:

Even with smaller teams, these features enable mid-sized businesses to function more effectively working smarter, not harder. To be more precise, business can also take advantages of Joule for reporting or taking accurate data from system is fraction of second.

7. Global Compliance with Local Precision

Localisations for more than 40 countries are pre-installed in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and include:

  • Handling all necessary documentation and compliance filings as per local requirements.
  • Meeting country-specific tax and legal obligations, including e-invoicing, GST, and VAT.
  •  Providing financial reporting structures and customized charts of accounts suited to local standards.

With all specific local features business can enter in the market with confidence as SAP has already taken all the headache and incorporated all region-specific issues in advanced in the SAP product, so business can concentrate on other important aspect which is important for business growth.

8. Collaborative Framework for Functional Integration

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud eliminates data silos and produces a unified picture of the company by integrating finance, supply chain, procurement, HR, and sales onto a single platform. Integrated analytics and dashboards provide decision-makers with real-time insights, such as:

  • Analysis of profitability by product, region, or customer
  • Current stock levels in every warehouse
  • Different pre-defined KPIs

Better decision-making, faster reactions, and more strategic growth planning are made possible by this instant visibility.

Summary:  Impact on mid-size businesses

SAP S/4HANA is a game-changer for mid-sized businesses, acting as a powerful catalyst for growth and innovation that goes well beyond just being a cloud-based ERP. The goal of SAP cloud ERP is to transition all mid-sized businesses to the cloud, allowing them to experience significant improvements by leveraging all the features and technologies available for their growth.

In summary, considering all these points, we can confidently say that SAP cloud ERP is a key driver of success. It supports businesses in various ways, including strategy, value, cost management, innovation, and fostering genuine growth.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud isn‚Äôt just a tool for businesses aiming to expand without the usual headaches; it‚Äôs a true partner in growth. With SAP S/4HANA Cloud, customers can expect to see a 50% reduction in IT staff compared to traditional ERP systems.

This blog post introduces a recent enhancement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition that significantly improves developer extensibility for the Document and Reporting Compliance solution in T√ºrkiye. This change enables developers to fully utilize the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method in the EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD BAdI, which is used to modify the XML files generated for an electronic document. 

Background 
In some scenarios, you would want to enhance the standard XML file generated for an electronic document - for example, to add optional fields or make changes based on specific business or legal requirements. The Document and Reporting Compliance framework provides the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method within the EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD BAdI to support such enhancements. This method allows partners to tailor the generated XML output to meet their needs. This was possible in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud; however, it was not available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, which limited flexibility for partners using the public cloud edition. 

However, until now, a key limitation with the Document and Reporting Compliance T√ºrkiye solution was that its service consumer structures were not released. As a result, accessing and modifying XML content through ABAP structures was not straightforward. These structures needed to be made available by SAP for the respective country to enable developer extensibility. Without them, enhancements through the BAdI were either restricted or not feasible. 

What‚Äôs New? 
To remove this limitation, SAP has now released all proxy objects for the T√ºrkiye Document and Reporting Compliance solution. As a result, developers can fully utilize the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method and enhance the XML output using standard proxy structures without any restrictions. 

Prerequisites 

  • You must have configured developer extensibility role in your configuration environment. 
    The required business role is SAP_BR_DEVELOPER. 

Implementation Steps in ABAP Development Tools (ADT): 

  1. In your ABAP project, go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD (path: package GLO-EDO > Enhancements > Enhancement Spots). 
  2. Right-click ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD and select New BAdI Enhancement Implementation. 
  3. Enter a package, name, and description. 
  4. Choose‚ÄØAdd BAdI Implementation‚ÄØand select for EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD. 
  5. Create a BAdI filter for Country (TR) and/or Generic Filter. 
  6. Choose‚ÄØImplementing Class‚ÄØto create a new implementation class. The new implementation class automatically implements the interfaces "if_badi_interfaces" and "if_edoc_adaptor_cloud". 
  7. After generating the class, open the interface method and press F3 to view its parameters. To display the documentation, press F2. 
  8. Activate your BAdI implementation. 

Example Implementation: 

To better illustrate how this enhancement can be used, we‚Äôll walk through two examples, one for a T√ºrkiye Basic eInvoice and another for a Delivery Note. 

Example 1: T√ºrkiye Basic eInvoice 

In this example, we demonstrate how to enhance the XML output using the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method: 

  1. We populate the <PaymentMeansCode> XML tag with a custom value. This tag is located within the <PaymentMeans> tag of the XML structure. 
  2. We will also fill the <AdditionalDocumentReference> tag with custom values. 

These enhancements are made possible by leveraging the released proxy structures, allowing for seamless customization without any limitations.

entry.title: Important Information About Converting Renumbered G/L Accounts with an Active Parallel Line:
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We've recently gotten some feedback regarding a specific point in the conversion process for renumbered G/L accounts and wanted to take a quick minute to spread the word as widely as possible.

When you're converting renumbered G/L accounts on a three-system landscape, that conversion process means a development system downtime (typically 2-4 hours). During this downtime, your business users can't access the SAP Fiori launchpad, so day-to-day business in the development system is blocked for that period of time.

So far, so good. But what if you have an active parallel line? 

In that case, the conversion process means a downtime for both development systems at the same time. It doesn't matter whether or not the accounts were branched (from the main line to the parallel line, or vice versa) or whether they exist in one line only: Converting renumbered G/L accounts in either  the main line or  the parallel line means a downtime for the development system across both lines.

Please keep this in mind when you're scheduling the conversion process for your renumbered G/L accounts!

As always, further information can be found on the SAP Help Portal.

And of course, if you have follow-up questions here, or want to know more about the renumbering process for your G/L accounts, feel free to ask in the comments--we can answer or make new posts to clarify additional issues that arise!

entry.title: NEW SAP Activate provisioning road map for SAP Business Suite packages.
entry.content:
Recently, SAP announced the availability of SAP Business Suite packages for customers to explore comprehensive packages tailored to their business and easily extended with modular add-ons. Learn more about the packages here.  

We are excited to announce that a new SAP Activate provisioning road map for Business Suite is now available in the SAP road map Viewer! The new content covers the provisioning process for the Finance and Supply Chain management packages. The Provisioning Enablement for SAP Cloud ERP Activate roadmap provides a step-by-step guide for provisioning and preparing the project systems. It covers the complete process from requesting systems to performing initial configurations, creating users, and ensuring readiness for project execution. 

What is SAP Business Suite:

SAP Business Suite integrates SAP cloud ERP applications, SAP Business AI, and SAP Business Data Cloud to deliver exceptional business value, all powered by the SAP Business Technology Platform. Focused on built-in innovation, AI agents and context-rich data are embedded into SAP's core cloud ERP and line-of-business applications. This unified approach to enterprise management helps organizations scale and succeed more easily than ever before. Read the SAP Business Suite page to learn more.

What's new in SAP Activate: 

Once customer sign a contract, they will receive an onboarding email with instructions on what to do next. The email links to this new roadmap, designed specifically to support Initial System Administrators in setting up their SAP Business Suite systems quickly and efficiently. It provides step-by-step guidance for requesting, receiving, and configuring your systems, ensuring your project teams have the access they need right from the start.

  • A clear sequence of tasks to follow 
  • Helpful guidance and best practices for system provisioning
  • Links to key accelerators, tools, and resources

How to get started: 

To help you get started, we‚Äôve created a short video that walks you through the roadmap, highlights what‚Äôs included, and shows you exactly where to find the content in Roadmap Viewer.

 

Start exploring the new roadmap here and if you are an initial Administrator or project lead, check it out, watch the video intro to get started, follow the steps and share your feedback to help us continuously improve the content.

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to my previous blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com

entry.title: Controlling, Scheduling, and Costing of Production Using Custom Fields in Routing Based on AVC
entry.content:
Business Requirement 

Company X wants to calculate the production cost based on the variant selected when placing an order for a product. 

Before Company X can quote a price to its customer, it would like to know the correct cost to achieve the right profit margin. The cost calculation should occur as soon as the order is received, and well before actual production begins.

Company X applies a multiplier to the standard cost of operations, which varies depending on the product's configuration. They want to execute the process in their SAP Cloud ERP.

Solution at high level
This solution will focus on calculating the production cost based on the configuration and making it visible at the sales order. It doesn't deal with sales order processes as a whole.
The multiplier that Company X uses is created as a custom field (called YY1_price_factor) in Production Routing.

Key Steps in the Solution

  1. Creating Custom Field
  2. Setting Up Configurable Material
  3. Integrating Workcenter Formula
  4. Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics
  5. Executing Business Processes

Creating Custom Fields

Company X uses a custom field, YY1_price_factor, within Production Routing. This field is set up using the Key User Extensibility's Custom Field App, under the Business Context: Manufacturing Bill of Operations Operation. The custom field is crucial for linking production routing operations to sales orders.

a. Choose Add Field in the Custom Fields app.The custom field YY1_price_factor is created for production routing operations.

b. Enable the business scenario Routing to Production Order on Operation Level for the custom field YY1_price_factor.

c. Optional: Enable the GUI in the User Interface tab if you wish to see the fields in the UI.

 

Setting Up Configurable Material

a. Set the configurable material as described. The configurable material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX is associated with class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX of class type 300. Characteristics such as AVC_CR_COUNTERWEIGHT_VXX or AVC_CR_FORKLIFT_VXX are used to execute sales order variant configurations.

b. Select the UsedfVarConfig checkbox.

 

Integrating Workcenter (WKC) Formula 

a. Map the custom field YY1_price_factor to the WKC formula parameter AZMDB1 in the Define Parameters activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities.

For more information, see also Configuration Environment of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

b. Create a WKC formula where the SAP standard parameter SAP_01 is multiplied by ZMDB1 to calculate costs in the Define Formulas for Work Centers activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities. 

For more details, see Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Custom Fields in Work Center Formula Parameters.

For more details on Work Center Formula, see the blog Controlling and Scheduling the Production Using the Work Center Formula Parameter.

Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics

To utilize YY1_price_factor in object dependency, it is referenced to the characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX. This characteristic is calculated using a procedure in production routing, ensuring accurate cost calculations based on configuration changes.

a. Create characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX using the Manage Characteristics app.

b. Reference the characteristic to the PLPO table with the field name YY1_price_factor_PPO in the Addnl data tab.

c. Assign characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX to class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX using the  Manage Classes app.

d. Assign the class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX to the configured material in Manage Product Master Data.

e. Create a global procedure with the characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX in production routing.

f. Maintain dependency with type Procedure.

g. Enter the formula in the Dependency Editor.

Executing Business Processes

Sales Order Impact

When a sales order is created for CM-MLFL-KM-VXX, the calculated cost and profit margin are displayed. Changes in configuration, such as altering the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg, dynamically adjust the costing and profit margin.

a. Set the counterweight to 2,000 kg in Variant Configuration.

The profit margin is calculated for 2,000 kgs. 

This solution focuses on calculating the production cost based on the configuration and displaying it on the sales order. It doesn't deal with sales order processes as a whole. The multiplier that Company X uses is created as a custom field (called YY1_price_factor) in Production Routing.

b. Set the counterweight to 5,000 kgs in Variant Configuration.The profit margin is calculated for 5,000 kgs. 

Production Order Impact

In production orders, the custom field price_factor reflects changes in sales order configurations. For instance, changing the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg adjusts the price_factor from 2 to 5, demonstrating the direct impact of configuration changes on production costs.

a. Search for the material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX in the Manage Material Coverage app.

 

b. Choose Start MRP Run to create a planned order.

c. Convert the planned order to a production order. Once the production order is created, check the User Field price_factor in Operations. For counterweight 2,000 KG, the price_factor is 2.

d. Now, if this counterweight is changed in the sales order variant config to 5,000 KG, and the MRP run happens again to create the production order in the same way as described above. The price_factor changes to 5 as shown below.

By integrating custom fields and formulas, Company X provides a streamlined approach to managing production costs, enhancing visibility and accuracy in sales orders and production processes. This solution empowers businesses to make informed decisions and optimize their operations.

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Control Tower: Q2 2025 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the first half of 2025, global sustainability governance has entered a new phase of scrutiny and recalibration. The EU Omnibus amendments to the CSRD have postponed timelines and reduced the scope of immediate obligations for thousands of companies, temporarily easing the pressure of compliance. However, this regulatory pause has only sharpened the spotlight on data integrity, preparedness, and strategic ESG integration. 

At the same time, investors, regulators, and civil society are intensifying their expectations. Public disclosures are no longer judged on completeness alone‚Äîthey must be audit-ready, aligned with recognized frameworks like ESRS and EU Taxonomy. Companies are expected to move beyond box-ticking compliance into continuous ESG performance management, proactively steering their sustainability journey. 

SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) is designed precisely for this challenge. It enables organizations to: 

  • Record ESG factors with out-of-the-box integration to SAP systems and trusted third-party sources 
  • Analyze performance across financial, operational, and sustainability dimensions to support informed decisions 
  • Accelerate the transition through auditable, framework-aligned reporting‚Äîcovering both regulatory and voluntary disclosures, powered by AI 

Building on our momentum from Q1, this quarter's updates focus on strengthening ESRS-aligned metric coverage, deeper analytical flexibility, improved auditability, and tighter alignment with financial structures. 

 

Expansion of SAP-provided metric coverage   

To support organizations on their ESRS compliance journey, SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) continues to expand its library of SAP-provided metrics aligned with the European Sustainability Reporting Standards. These include both qualitative and quantitative definitions based on EFRAG's implementation guidance. Current metric coverage is available in the SAP Help Portal and detailed in the SAP Community blog, offering transparency and reuse for accelerated implementation.  

 

Looking ahead, we plan to reach approximately 80% coverage of ESRS data points by the end of 2025, including metrics from ESRS 2, S2‚ÄìS4, G1, and additional quantitative metrics from ESRS Topical Standards. This roadmap aims to enable our customers to progressively adopt SCT content for structured, auditable, and regulation-ready ESG disclosures while maintaining flexibility to extend for sector-specific or company-specific needs. 

 

Analyze ESG Data App Enhancements 

The Analyze ESG Data application now offers a significantly improved analytics experience with the introduction of the Analytics tab. Users can explore all standard custom quantitative metrics in greater depth by applying drill-down dimensions, choosing between chart or table formats, and configuring default views tailored to reporting needs. This new flexibility allows up to three charts to be displayed simultaneously, each with independent metric, period, and structure settings. 

In parallel, users can manage and switch between saved configurations of grouped metric tiles (‚ÄúOverviews‚Äù), enabling different perspectives for different stakeholders or strategic priorities. Together, these enhancements empower users to personalize and streamline how ESG data is analyzed, viewed, and shared ‚Äì supporting more informed decision-making and stronger alignment with sustainability goals. Find full details here: Using the Analyze ESG Data Application.

 

Custom Templates for ‚ÄúGenerate ESG Reports with AI‚Äù App 

The Generate ESG Reports with AI app now offers greater flexibility and control through the introduction of custom templates. Users can create or edit templates to tailor the structure and content of ESG reports using available SAP-provided quantitative metrics.  

Within the Templates section, you can now select ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù to build a new template or modify an existing one by adding sections and subsections, defining narrative text, and selecting from a predefined list of charts and tables. For each component, a content preview is available to ensure alignment with the selected reporting period. Once finalized, templates can be saved and reused, enabling consistent and structured ESG reporting across time periods.  

When generating a report, you can preview or download the result as a PDF‚Äîand for added customization, you can edit any section manually. SAP's built-in AI-assistance now supports dynamic revisions: simply select a passage and use the ‚ÄúRevise‚Äù option to receive suggestions to shorten or lengthen the text, helping refine your final ESG narrative with ease and speed. 

 

Fiscal Period Support 

The new Manage Fiscal Year Variants app brings flexible fiscal period support to SAP Sustainability Control Tower, allowing customers to define and activate custom fiscal year variants that align with their internal planning cycles. Whether using standard calendar months or granular date-based periods (like semi-monthly ranges), organizations can now tailor their ESG data analysis and reporting across key apps such as Analyze ESG Data, Manage GHG Data, and View Emission Dashboard. Built-in validation checks help ensure data compatibility, with options to consolidate or reimport data when switching to a new variant. This enables more accurate reporting, tighter alignment with financial periods, and greater control over how sustainability data is structured and interpreted across the organization. 

 

Change log updates 

In Q2, we've significantly improved transparency and traceability across SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT). Users can now track create, update, and delete changes to public overview configurations in the Analyze ESG Data app using the View Change Logs app. This functionality extends further, providing detailed logs for changes in business activity data, clearly showing the number of updated or imported records and distinguishing between actual and target data. 

 

New Languages Supported 

To better serve global enterprises, SAP SCT now supports Turkish and Italian languages. This update enables local teams to work in their native languages and enhances cross-regional collaboration on sustainability data collection and reporting. 

 

H2 2025 Roadmap Updates 

Looking ahead, we‚Äôre focused on simplifying and harmonizing ESG data consumption and reporting. A key milestone will be the delivery of a unified Read API for metric values ‚Äì supporting both quantitative and qualitative data ‚Äì to  make calculated ESG metrics easily accessible to external tools like disclosure management platforms. This API will also expose key metadata (including ESG standard references) and allow for both bulk and individual metric retrieval based on reporting scopes. We‚Äôre also working on improving flexibility in data modeling by enabling custom account groups, account-to-group mappings, and supporting activity data input through multiple channels. Additionally, we‚Äôll continue expanding metric-level analysis, measure drilldowns, and export formats in the Analyze ESG data application. To enhance data quality and reporting alignment, we‚Äôre introducing tools for guiding data requirements based on double materiality, setting up reporting hierarchies and data sources, and improving transparency on data completeness. In parallel, we aim to deliver ESRS-aligned metric definitions that cover up to 70% of EFRAG's guidance, along with clear documentation and community updates to keep you informed as mentioned above. Stay tuned: SCT Roadmap Explorer. 

 

Additional Information 

For in-depth details on SAP Sustainability Control Tower, we recommend browsing the SAP Help Portal. For an overview of all new features and functions, check the What‚Äôs New section, which is updated with every new software release.

entry.title: Transforming User Experience: SAP Fiori Launchpad adopts the latest SAP Design System updates
entry.content:
Overview

The SAP Fiori launchpad now incorporates the latest SAP Design System, bringing improvements to the shell bar and navigation area, user menu and notifications. These enhancements are designed to unify and streamline the user experience, ensuring the interface is more intuitive and consistent across SAP's portfolio, in alignment with our Suite First strategy.

 

Feature release outlook

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This feature is available with 2508. Parts of it will be offered as opt-in (refer to the  SAP KBA and SAP Note).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment

This feature is available with 2508 (only when spaces and pages are enabled).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP Integrated Business Planning

This feature is available with 2508.

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

 

Key Highlights

Shell Bar 

A key update is the repositioning of the navigation menu. It is now prominently located at the top of the shell bar, enabling users to access the navigation menu swiftly and efficiently.

Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu was designed to support the personalization of spaces.
  • After: The functionality has been enhanced, and the navigation menu now offers seamless access to navigation.

Additionally, for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud and SAP BTP ABAP environment the shell bar now supports displaying the product name alongside the company or brand logo. Administrators can manage and translate the product name using the WINDOW_TITLE_EXTENSION parameter located in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, e.g. refer to Manage Launchpad Settings | SAP Help Portal for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Before and After:

  • Before: The product name could not be included in the shell bar.
  • After: The product name is now configurable and can be displayed in the shell bar next to the company or brand logo. Likewise, the browser window title, the product name next to the logo and the app title are now synchronized. 

                                                                                                   

 

Navigation menu

 

‚ÄÉ

The navigation can now be accessed using the navigation menu. If the My Home space is configured, you will see the Favorites Apps section .(For SAP S/4HANA My Home space is in sync with the Favorites). Following this, you'll find the My Spaces section. In this section, you can view all your personalized spaces and pages.

If the SPACES_NAVIGATION_BAR_PERSONALIZATION setting is enabled in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, you'll see the All Spaces option, which allows for personalization of spaces (pinning and unpinning spaces).

 Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu had a different position in the shell bar, providing options for personalizing spaces.
  • After: The most significant advantage of the navigation is that it allows you to directly access entries from within any application, eliminating the need to return to the home page first.

User Menu

The user menu has been updated from a simple popover with a list to a more visually appealing design. The entries have been reordered according to new UXC guidelines, placing ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô at the top. The menu now can display an avatar, user's ID or the e-mail address depending on configuration options in the different products or platforms. Previously, the sign-out option was a standard list item located at the end of the list. It has now been relocated to the footer of the user menu.

Before and After:

  • Before: The user menu previously was a basic list items menu.
  • After: The user menu has been redesigned to provide a more intuitive user experience.

Notifications

 

Earlier, notifications could be grouped by Date, Type, and Priority. Considering recent usage data that indicated minimal use of the "By Type" option, the UI has been simplified by eliminating this grouping. Notifications can now be sorted using a sort of button, with options to arrange them by date or by importance.

Moreover, while in the notifications view, users can easily navigate to notification settings in the user menu by using the Settings icon in the upper-right corner.

Before and After:

  • Before: Previously, notifications were grouped by Date, Type, or Priority.
  • After: Notifications are now organized by date or importance, with direct access to settings via the Settings  icon.

Conclusion

With the adoption of the latest SAP Design System we strive to empower users to navigate and use SAP applications with greater ease and efficiency.

entry.title: Transport Management in SAP Cloud ERP 3SL Architecture During Upgrades
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP Cloud ERP's 3-system landscape (3SL) architecture, transport management becomes particularly complex during release upgrades. This Blogpost provides comprehensive guidance on managing transports when systems are at different release levels, addressing common challenges and best practices.

Understanding the 3SL Upgrade Timeline

In the standard three-system landscape, the test system is upgraded three weeks before the development and production systems during each release cycle. This approach provides sufficient time for regression testing before upgrading the remaining systems

Transport Types in SAP Cloud ERP

Before examining specific scenarios, it's essential to understand the three primary transport types:

  •  Customizing Transports: Generated because of Configuration changes via Central Business Configuration or Implementation activities Application.
  •  Developer Extensibility Transports: Created when any kind of ABAP developers extensions created generally via ABAP development tool.
  •  Key User Extensibility Transports: Created as a result of Key user extensions for example Custom field and logic, Custom business objects etc.

Transport Management Scenarios

Scenario 1: Uniform Release Level (N-N-N)

When development, test, and production systems operate at the same release level, transport management follows the standard process:

  • Export all transport types from the development system
  • Import transports into the test system
  • Forward transports to the production system
  • Complete the process by importing into the production system

Scenario 2: Mixed Release Levels (N-N+1-N)

This scenario occurs during the upgrade window when the test system operates at a higher release level than development and production systems.

For Customizing and Developer Extensibility Transports

The standard transport process from Scenario 1 remains applicable.

For Key User Extensibility Transports

Certain objects face import restrictions into higher release systems. For example, SAP Fiori Launchpad Pages (UIPC) during 2502 release (reference: 3560509 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 in a 3-system landscape: Release Restriction Note - SAP for Me).

Transports which contain these kinds of objects are shown as outdated. And we have two options for managing them:

Option A: Forward Without Import

Forward the transport from the test system without importing it, and then import it into the productive system

Option B: Re-export After Alignment

After all systems have been upgraded to the same level, you have to re-export the same content again from the development system and transport to test and production system, so as to ensure that the key user extensibility is also in the test system.

Thank you for reading this blog post, hopefully, the blog post was informative and helped you to understand in detail how to manage Transports during upgrade.

Note: You can't import a transport created on release n into release n+2 and higher, which means that you have to recreate the transport in the development system. However, it is not possible to recreate CBC transports. In this case, you have to create a support incident.

Note: To identify the objects not supported for N,N+1 Transports For 2508 Release, Please read the Release Note that generally released 2 Weeks before the T system upgrade.

entry.title: Staff your SAP Cloud ERP Enterprise Projects with the right Employees
entry.content:
Effective project and resource management is crucial for companies to deliver successful projects. Organizations running Enterprise Projects and/or Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP have the possibility to leverage SAP Project and Resource Management to optimize the project success. Resource Management is a process which spans normally over the complete lifetime of a project, starting with the initial finding and assignment of people, doing the continuous staffing forecasts and handling conflicts like substituting people. This blog provides an overview of how SAP Project and Resource Management facilitates these different staffing capabilities during the project life cycle of Enterprise Projects in SAP Cloud ERP.

Introduction:

Enterprise projects in SAP Cloud ERP   can be used to manage different kinds of projects in different industries. Examples are:

    • Overhead projects: for example, administrative projects or projects for research and development,
    • Investment projects: for example, projects to develop or maintain physical assets,
    • Projects with revenue: for example, engineer-to-order projects,
    • Statistical projects: can be used for certain reporting needs, without carry actual costs itself

Details about the different Project Types are documented in the following blog:
The two project control possibilities in SAP S/4HA... - SAP Community

 

Optimizing Resource Allocation:

Even in a simple project scenario, where an enterprise project merely serves as a cost collector without a formal project structure, managing resources is still required. Team members can log hours against the project, so optimizing resource allocation is crucial. To do this, you need clear visibility of available and skilled resources

Resource Management capability of SAP Project and Resource Management covers the following key aspects:

  • Transparency: Overview of projects people are working on and identification of conflicts
  • Reduce time to staff for Projects:
    • Staffing: Find available and skilled people and staff persons as requested and consider their availability
    • AI-assisted skill matching: overcome challenges like outdated employee profiles and reviewing many profiles manually
  • Increase staffing accuracy: Project workers can directly maintain their forecasts based on when they are needed for a project
  • Increase time-booking quality: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Timesheet worklist includes projects on which person is staffed
  • Single source of truth: the close integration between resource management information with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Project data provides synchronized data
  • SAP unified User Experience
  • Simple to adapt 

 

Basic scenarios and concepts:

SAP Project and Resource Management is a SaaS offering on SAP Business Technology Platform. Once the subscription is in place a scope item facilitates the setup.

Users can choose if resource management apps for business users should directly run in the SAP Cloud ERP Launchpad, e.g. Project Managers using the Project-related apps can also directly see the resource management apps they need.

 

Setup:

To proceed with the setup the following sources contain more details.
Administration Guide:
https://help.sap.com/docs/PPRM_OD/542f4545bc9d4ecd80bc3a0a6913a735/434f2ec669444cc98583a1c4eadca05a.html

The blog ‚ÄúSetup Resource Management Capability in SAP Project and Resource Management‚Äù provides a summary how to proceed by setting up the integration:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/setup-resource-management-capability-in-sap-projects-and-resource/ba-p/13999829

 

Process:

Harmonizing staffing with project setup and milestone planning can reduce Backoffice efforts and allow people to focus on what is needed to deliver projects successfully instead of spending effort in maintaining consistent information across different sources.  

The process starts in SAP Cloud ERP when a Resource demand is created:

 


Screen shows the resource demand defined in the Enterprise Project

Once the Enterprise Project Integration is setup for SAP Cloud ERP ‚Äúhuman resource‚Äù demands create the Resource Requests in Resource Management.

The process is explained along the most used apps in this blog.

1. Manage Resource Requests (Role: Project Manager)

Resource Request contains the need for a specific resource and is normally being refined by a user, e.g. Project Manager. During the refinement information about needed skills, scope description, requested resource organization are added. Once the request is complete the Project Manager can ‚Äúpublish‚Äù the request, so it becomes visible to the Resource Managers. No need to send additional information via email and capture the information directly where it is needed.


Screen shows the resource request which was published and includes ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP‚Äù as a required skill

 

2. Staff Resource Requests (Role: Resource Manager)

Resource Managers review the request and start now with the search of candidates. Availability and Skill matching are performed and available candidates identified. Resource Manager can propose or directly staff one or multiple candidates:

  • Proposing a candidate, allows Project Manager to accept / decline candidates
  • Soft booking is not yet confirmed staffing and only visible in resource management, while Hard booking is a confirmed booking type and people will see staffing in the SAP Cloud ERP timesheet app.
  • Forward requests, in case no suitable candidates are identified a request can be forwarded to another organization

Learn more how the AI-Assisted Advanced Skill Matching facilitates the search of skilled candidates check:
Unlock Efficient Resource Management with AI in SA... - SAP Community


Screen shows the matching candidates list and the Advanced Skill Match for Lilian Blair ‚Äì Lilian is being assigned by using the ‚ÄúQuick Assign‚Äù feature

 

3. Manage Resource Utilization (Role: Resource Manager)

Provides transparency how people are utilized, visualizes conflicts of over / under bookings and shows directly on which projects and roles people are working.

Resource Managers can also create, change and move assignments in order to resolve conflicts and adjust the planning.


Screen shows a list of filtered employees which includes Lilian Blair and her staffing for the Project Expert role

 

4. My Assignments (Role: Project Team Member)

Once employees are staffed and have the needed authorization, they can maintain a staffing forecast means they can adjust in which weeks they work how many hours on a project. This allows them to refine and balance between different project assignments and align their involvement along with the planned project milestones, considering planned absences etc.

The updated information is afterwards visible for Resource- and Project Managers to ensure everyone has the updated information.



Screen shows mobile view of Lilian‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy Assignment‚Äù app.

Staffed hours and candidates will be visible in SAP Cloud ERP. The Enterprise Project demand will get directly information about the assigned people and hours. This helps to bring up staffing information in the employee‚Äôs timesheet worklist to simplify timesheet capturing and reduce the time to find the right project.

 

Summary:

Resources assignments and staffed hours are kept in synch between the SAP Cloud ERP and Resource Management, which ensures that all users have the same view on resource demands and what is being staffed.

SAP Project and Resource Management supports you by gaining transparency on your resource utilization situation with a fully integrated and embedded into the SAP User Experience scenario.

To learn more and to explore Resource Management in SAP Project and Resource Management you can find more information and access the free trial under:

https://www.sap.com/prm

 

Companies running Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP can also consult the following blog:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/overcoming-challenges-in-staffing-customer-projects-with-sap-project-and/ba-p/13748436

entry.title: API Consumption - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition
entry.content:
With the evolving SAP landscape and customers moving to S/4 HANA Cloud , our prime focus as a consultant is to follow a clean core approach.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) is one such platform which helps us in discovering standard APIs,Events, Extensibility options

which we can consume in our S/4 HANA landscape to achieve end-to-end business functionality. This blog focusses mainly on the API consumption from

SAP Business Accelerator HUB and how it differs between the two of the S/4 HANA Cloud offerings - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition.

We will first go through some of the basic differences and then focus on technically how we can use or consume these APIs in each of the environments.

 

S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

Where to find?

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile -

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile ‚Äì

 

Activation

 

Communication management based API Activation. APIs are part of a standard communication scenario. Communication scenario can be found from SAP Business Accelerator HUB as below ‚Äì

 

 

SICF based API activation(OData V2)For OData V4 no specific activation is needed but the Service Group needs to be published. Not associated to any communication scenario.

 

 

Sandbox availability

‚ÄúTryOut‚Äù option available in SAP Business Accelerator HUB for OData APIs to execute the CRUD methods with Sandbox data. Also you can deploy your own system to do tryout with your actual data of your S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition system.

 

 

 

No Tryout option available with any Sandbox. Also here the S/4 HANA system is in a private network and often there will be a Cloud Connector in between so TryOut options have been restricted for APIs for Private Edition

 

 


 

 

 

Consumption

API is consumed through a communication arrangement which is based on a standard communication scenario. Standard Fiori Application -   Communication Arrangements to be used for consumption.

For OData V2 API is activated through transaction code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE.

For OData V4 API no separates activation is required but service group needs to be published through transaction code - /n/IWFND/V4_ADMIN

Practice Guide

We will be using OData V2 - API - API_PRODUCT_SRV as an example to demonstrate the activation of the API in S/4 HANA Public Cloud and S/4 HANA Private Cloud.

API Link for Public Edition ‚Äì https://api.sap.com/api/API_PRODUCT_SRV/overview

API Link for Private Edition - https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview

 

Scenario 1# Activating API in Public Cloud ‚Äì

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview  for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API and is ‚ÄúActive‚Äù  for usage.

 

From SAP Business Accelerator HUB you will get the SAP standard communication scenario for the API ‚Äì

 

Here we will be creating arrangement for communication scenario ‚Äì SAP_COM_009

Next create a communication user from the Fiori application ‚ÄúCreate Communication User‚Äù.

 

Give a Username and you can use the ‚ÄúPropose Password‚Äù option or you can add your own password.

 

Next step is to create a communication system from the Fiori application ‚ÄúCommunication Systems‚Äù

 

Click on ‚ÄúNew‚Äù and provide a System ID and System Name ‚Äì

 

 

Go to tab ‚ÄúUsers for Inbound Communication‚Äù and assign the user you just created in the previous step using ‚ÄúCreate Communication Users‚Äù.

 

 

For the ease of use you can check the checkbox ‚ÄúInbound Only‚Äù which means you are not expecting any outbound communication (S/4HANA -> External) through this communication system and so you will not be asked to enter any user for Outbound communication user for this communication system.

Save the communication system.

Next step is to create the communication arrangement. Go to application ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangements‚Äù

 

Click on ‚ÄúNew‚Äù

In the following tab enter ‚ÄúSAP_COM_0009‚Äù as the standard communication scenario for API_PRODUCT_SRV.

 

Select the ‚ÄòCommunication System'(from value help) which we have just created in the previous step. The assigned Communication User will now automatically appear in User Name field.

 

Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and it will activate your communication arrangement.

You can get your actual service URL for all Inbound Services associated, under the tab ‚ÄúInbound Services‚Äù under the column ‚ÄúService URL/Service Interface‚Äù.

Similarly all the Outbound services associated with this communication Scenario ‚ÄúSAP_COM_0009‚Äù will show under the tab ‚ÄúOutbound Services‚Äù.Outbound services are generally either SOAP Outbound services or IDOCs.

 

 

All the services that belong to the communication scenario ‚ÄúSAP_COM_0009‚Äù will be listed here under the tab ‚ÄúInbound Service‚Äù.

Get the URL where the Service says ‚ÄúProduct Master(A2X)‚Äù / OData V2‚Äù

 

The API link looks like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV

So this makes your API ready for consumption from the external system.

Get the service URL and test it from POSTMAN using the communication user that you created in the first step. In POSTMAN you can use it for Basic Authentication under Authorization.

You can call this URL from SAP Integration Suite using a OData V2 Adapter with basic authentication with the user you created in ‚ÄúCommunication User‚Äù application.

Note ‚Äì For Public cloud the way of activating a OData V2 service and OData V4 service are same unlike Private Cloud where there is a difference.

So for OData V4 the API will be also activated by a communication arrangement only as shown above and the URL will look like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0002/

Link to API Hub for the OData V4 API of Product Master - https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview

 

Scenario 2# Activating API in Private Cloud ‚Äì

First step same as Public cloud to find the API from https://api.sap.com/ .

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with ‚ÄúProduct master‚Äù and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API.

 

 

Next Run Transaction Code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE

Click on ‚ÄúAdd Service‚Äù

Provide System Alias = ‚ÄúLOCAL‚Äù and under Technical Service name ‚Äì ‚ÄúAPI_PRODUCT_SRV‚Äù and click on ‚ÄúGet Services‚Äù

 

Then select the service you want to activate and click on ‚ÄúAdd Selected Services‚Äù

You can provide the package where you want to assign the service.

 

If you want to use OAuth authentication you have to check the checkbox ‚ÄúEnable OAuth for Service‚Äù

The next step is to activate the service as shown below. However it is recommended to go and activate the service from SICF transaction code.

 

Your OData V2 Activation is complete and you can test it from the Gateway. You can call this service now from SAP Integration Suite with a technical user who has the necessary roles.

 

 

Bonus Scenario # Now we will see how we can activate a similar OData V4 service of Product Master.

To find the OData V4 API go to https://api.sap.com/ and go to the node ‚Äì ‚ÄúSAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition‚Äù

:291522iD133E2FCB72EF160:

 

Under APIs->ODATA V4 -> Search Product

 

Select the ‚ÄúOdata V4‚Äù one which is ‚ÄúActive‚Äù and not ‚ÄúDEPRECATED‚Äù

 

Under API Resources -> Attributes you will find the Service Group Name which you need to publish.
